x-fapi-auth-date.description:
The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP. 
All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below: 
Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

x-fapi-customer-ip-address.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

x-fapi-interaction-id.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

Authorization.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

x-customer-user-agent.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

$ul: **Data**
**Party**
**AccountRole**: A partyâ€™s role with respect to the related account.
**Address**
**BeneficialOwnership**
**EmailAddress**: Address for electronic mail (e-mail).
**FullLegalName**: Specifies a character string with a maximum length of 350 characters.
**LegalStructure**: Legal standing of the party.
**Mobile**: Collection of information that identifies a mobile phone number, as defined by telecom services.
**Name**: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party.
**PartyId**: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the customer resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.
**PartyNumber**: Number assigned by an agent to identify its customer.
**PartyType**: Party type, in a coded form.
**Phone**: Collection of information that identifies a phone number, as defined by telecom services.
**Relationships**: The Party's relationships with other resources.
**Account**: Relationship to the Account resource.
**Id**: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the related resource.
**Related**: Absolute URI to the related resource.
**Links**: Links relevant to the payload
**First**
**Last**
**Next**
**Prev**
**Self**
**Meta**: Meta Data relevant to the payload
**FirstAvailableDateTime**: All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
**LastAvailableDateTime**: All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
**TotalPages**

$block: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

$ul: **Code**: High level textual error code, to help categorize the errors.
**Errors**
**Id**: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors.
**Message**: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'
